alert.note: Alert for Laurel; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 2:28PM EDT until May 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Laurel, Pulaski, Rockcastle and Wayne. In southeast Kentucky, Jackson and Owsley. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 228 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Somerset, London, Mount Vernon, McKee, Science Hill, Burnside, Pongo, Bloss, Billows, Luner, Hansford, Sand Springs, Sand Hill, Wellhope, Level Green, Bunch, Wabp, Bent, Bernstadt and Valley Oak. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
